intro: Acourtia oaxacana, commonly known as Oaxacan acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring. Acourtia oaxacana is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
